<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>getDatacenter(args?: <a href='#GetDatacenterArgs'>GetDatacenterArgs</a>, opts?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#InvokeOptions'>pulumi.InvokeOptions</a>): <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='#GetDatacenterResult'>GetDatacenterResult</a>&gt; &amp; <a href='#GetDatacenterResult'>GetDatacenterResult</a></code></pre>


The `vsphere..Datacenter` data source can be used to discover the ID of a
vSphere datacenter. This can then be used with resources or data sources that
require a datacenter, such as the [`vsphere..Host`][data-source-vsphere-host]
data source.

[data-source-vsphere-host]: /docs/providers/vsphere/d/host.html

#### Example Usage

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const datacenter = vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
});
```

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/d/datacenter.html.markdown.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="getDatastore" data-link-title="getDatastore">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/getDatastore.ts#L34">
        Data Source <strong>getDatastore</strong>
    </a>
</h3>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>getDatastore(args: <a href='#GetDatastoreArgs'>GetDatastoreArgs</a>, opts?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#InvokeOptions'>pulumi.InvokeOptions</a>): <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='#GetDatastoreResult'>GetDatastoreResult</a>&gt; &amp; <a href='#GetDatastoreResult'>GetDatastoreResult</a></code></pre>


The `vsphere..getDatastore` data source can be used to discover the ID of a
datastore in vSphere. This is useful to fetch the ID of a datastore that you
want to use to create virtual machines in using the
[`vsphere..VirtualMachine`][docs-virtual-machine-resource] resource.

[docs-virtual-machine-resource]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/virtual_machine.html

#### Example Usage

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const datacenter = vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
});
const datastore = vsphere.getDatastore({
    datacenterId: datacenter.id,
    name: "datastore1",
});
```

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/d/datastore.html.markdown.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="getDatastoreCluster" data-link-title="getDatastoreCluster">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/getDatastoreCluster.ts#L39">
        Data Source <strong>getDatastoreCluster</strong>
    </a>
</h3>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>getDatastoreCluster(args: <a href='#GetDatastoreClusterArgs'>GetDatastoreClusterArgs</a>, opts?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#InvokeOptions'>pulumi.InvokeOptions</a>): <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='#GetDatastoreClusterResult'>GetDatastoreClusterResult</a>&gt; &amp; <a href='#GetDatastoreClusterResult'>GetDatastoreClusterResult</a></code></pre>


The `vsphere..DatastoreCluster` data source can be used to discover the ID of a
datastore cluster in vSphere. This is useful to fetch the ID of a datastore
cluster that you want to use to assign datastores to using the
[`vsphere..NasDatastore`][docs-nas-datastore-resource] or
[`vsphere..VmfsDatastore`][docs-vmfs-datastore-resource] resources, or create
virtual machines in using the
[`vsphere..VirtualMachine`][docs-virtual-machine-resource] resource.

[docs-nas-datastore-resource]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/nas_datastore.html
[docs-vmfs-datastore-resource]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/vmfs_datastore.html
[docs-virtual-machine-resource]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/virtual_machine.html

#### Example Usage

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const datacenter = vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
});
const datastoreCluster = vsphere_datacenter_dc.id.apply(id => vsphere.getDatastoreCluster({
    datacenterId: id,
    name: "datastore-cluster1",
}));
```

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/d/datastore_cluster.html.markdown.

The `vsphere..Folder` data source can be used to get the general attributes of a
vSphere inventory folder. Paths are absolute and include must include the
datacenter.

#### Example Usage

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const folder = vsphere.getFolder({
    path: "/dc1/datastore/folder1",
});
```

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/d/folder.html.markdown.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="getResourcePool" data-link-title="getResourcePool">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/getResourcePool.ts#L62">
        Data Source <strong>getResourcePool</strong>
    </a>
</h3>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>getResourcePool(args?: <a href='#GetResourcePoolArgs'>GetResourcePoolArgs</a>, opts?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#InvokeOptions'>pulumi.InvokeOptions</a>): <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='#GetResourcePoolResult'>GetResourcePoolResult</a>&gt; &amp; <a href='#GetResourcePoolResult'>GetResourcePoolResult</a></code></pre>


The `vsphere..ResourcePool` data source can be used to discover the ID of a
resource pool in vSphere. This is useful to fetch the ID of a resource pool
that you want to use to create virtual machines in using the
[`vsphere..VirtualMachine`][docs-virtual-machine-resource] resource.

[docs-virtual-machine-resource]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/virtual_machine.html

#### Example Usage

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const datacenter = vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
});
const pool = vsphere.getResourcePool({
    datacenterId: datacenter.id,
    name: "resource-pool-1",
});
```

##### Specifying the root resource pool for a standalone host

> **NOTE:** Fetching the root resource pool for a cluster can now be done
directly via the [`vsphere..ComputeCluster`][docs-compute-cluster-data-source]
data source.

[docs-compute-cluster-data-source]: /docs/providers/vsphere/d/compute_cluster.html

All compute resources in vSphere (clusters, standalone hosts, and standalone
ESXi) have a resource pool, even if one has not been explicitly created. This
resource pool is referred to as the _root resource pool_ and can be looked up
by specifying the path as per the example below:

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const pool = vsphere_datacenter_dc.id.apply(id => vsphere.getResourcePool({
    datacenterId: id,
    name: "esxi1/Resources",
}));
```

For more information on the root resource pool, see [Managing Resource
Pools][vmware-docs-resource-pools] in the vSphere documentation.

[vmware-docs-resource-pools]: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-60077B40-66FF-4625-934A-641703ED7601.html

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/d/resource_pool.html.markdown.

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
```

```typescript
    name: "dc1",
});
const template = vsphere.getVirtualMachine({
    datacenterId: datacenter.id,
    name: "test-vm-template",
});
```

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="getVmfsDisks" data-link-title="getVmfsDisks">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/getVmfsDisks.ts#L39">
        Data Source <strong>getVmfsDisks</strong>
    </a>
</h3>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>getVmfsDisks(args: <a href='#GetVmfsDisksArgs'>GetVmfsDisksArgs</a>, opts?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#InvokeOptions'>pulumi.InvokeOptions</a>): <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='#GetVmfsDisksResult'>GetVmfsDisksResult</a>&gt; &amp; <a href='#GetVmfsDisksResult'>GetVmfsDisksResult</a></code></pre>


The `vsphere..getVmfsDisks` data source can be used to discover the storage
devices available on an ESXi host. This data source can be combined with the
[`vsphere..VmfsDatastore`][data-source-vmfs-datastore] resource to create VMFS
datastores based off a set of discovered disks.

[data-source-vmfs-datastore]: /docs/providers/vsphere/r/vmfs_datastore.html

#### Example Usage

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as vsphere from "@pulumi/vsphere";

const datacenter = vsphere.getDatacenter({
    name: "dc1",
});
const host = vsphere.getHost({
    datacenterId: datacenter.id,
    name: "esxi1",
});
const available = vsphere.getVmfsDisks({
    filter: "mpx.vmhba1:C0:T[12]:L0",
    hostSystemId: host.id,
    rescan: true,
});
```

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-vsphere/blob/master/website/docs/d/vmfs_disks.html.markdown.

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L935">property <b>haAdmissionControlFailoverHostSystemIds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlFailoverHostSystemIds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Defines the
[managed object IDs][docs-about-morefs] of hosts to use as dedicated failover
hosts. These hosts are kept as available as possible - admission control will
block access to the host, and DRS will ignore the host when making
recommendations.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L943">property <b>haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum number
of failed hosts that admission control tolerates when making decisions on
whether to permit virtual machine operations. The maximum is one less than
the number of hosts in the cluster. Default: `1`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L950">property <b>haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The percentage of
resource reduction that a cluster of virtual machines can tolerate in case of
a failover. A value of 0 produces warnings only, whereas a value of 100
disables the setting. Default: `100` (disabled).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L956">property <b>haAdmissionControlPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlPolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The type of admission control
policy to use with vSphere HA. Can be one of `resourcePercentage`,
`slotPolicy`, `failoverHosts`, or `disabled`. Default: `resourcePercentage`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L966">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Automatically determine available resource percentages by subtracting the
average number of host resources represented by the
`haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance`
setting from the total amount of resources in the cluster. Disable to supply
user-defined values. Default: `true`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L972">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined percentage of CPU resources in the cluster to reserve for
failover. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L978">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined percentage of memory resources in the cluster to reserve for
failover. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L983">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined CPU slot size, in MHz. Default: `32`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L988">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined memory slot size, in MB. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L995">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls
whether or not you wish to supply explicit values to CPU and memory slot
sizes. The default is `false`, which tells vSphere to gather a automatic
average based on all powered-on virtual machines currently in the cluster.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haAdvancedOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1000">property <b>haAdvancedOptions</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdvancedOptions?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;}&gt;;</code></pre>

A key/value map that specifies advanced
options for vSphere HA.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1007">property <b>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take
on virtual machines if an APD status on an affected datastore clears in the
middle of an APD event. Can be one of `none` or `reset`. Default: `none`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haDatastoreApdResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1015">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected loss to all paths to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`,
`restartConservative`, or `restartAggressive`.  Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haDatastoreApdResponseDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1022">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the delay in minutes
to wait after an APD timeout event to execute the response action defined in
`haDatastoreApdResponse`. Default: `3`
minutes. <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haDatastorePdlResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1030">property <b>haDatastorePdlResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastorePdlResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected a permanent device loss to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`, or
`restartAggressive`. Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1035">property <b>haEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haEnabled?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable vSphere HA for this cluster. Default:
`false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haHeartbeatDatastoreIds">

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The list of managed object IDs for
preferred datastores to use for HA heartbeating. This setting is only useful
when `haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy` is set
to either `userSelectedDs` or `allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1049">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The selection policy for HA
heartbeat datastores. Can be one of `allFeasibleDs`, `userSelectedDs`, or
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`. Default:
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haHostIsolationResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1056">property <b>haHostIsolationResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHostIsolationResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The action to take on virtual
machines when a host has detected that it has been isolated from the rest of
the cluster. Can be one of `none`, `powerOff`, or `shutdown`. Default:
`none`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haHostMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1062">property <b>haHostMonitoring</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHostMonitoring?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Global setting that controls whether
vSphere HA remediates virtual machines on host failure. Can be one of `enabled`
or `disabled`. Default: `enabled`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmComponentProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1069">property <b>haVmComponentProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmComponentProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls vSphere VM component
protection for virtual machines in this cluster. Can be one of `enabled` or
`disabled`. Default: `enabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmDependencyRestartCondition">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1079">property <b>haVmDependencyRestartCondition</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmDependencyRestartCondition?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The condition used to
determine whether or not virtual machines in a certain restart priority class
are online, allowing HA to move on to restarting virtual machines on the next
priority. Can be one of `none`, `poweredOn`, `guestHbStatusGreen`, or
`appHbStatusGreen`. The default is `none`, which means that a virtual machine
is considered ready immediately after a host is found to start it on.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmFailureInterval">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1085">property <b>haVmFailureInterval</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmFailureInterval?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If a heartbeat from a virtual machine
is not received within this configured interval, the virtual machine is
marked as failed. The value is in seconds. Default: `30`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmMaximumFailureWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1094">property <b>haVmMaximumFailureWindow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMaximumFailureWindow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The length of the reset window in
which `haVmMaximumResets` can operate. When this
window expires, no more resets are attempted regardless of the setting
configured in `haVmMaximumResets`. `-1` means no window, meaning an
unlimited reset time is allotted. The value is specified in seconds. Default:
`-1` (no window).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmMaximumResets">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1099">property <b>haVmMaximumResets</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMaximumResets?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum number of resets that HA will
perform to a virtual machine when responding to a failure event. Default: `3`

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmMinimumUptime">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1105">property <b>haVmMinimumUptime</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMinimumUptime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The time, in seconds, that HA waits after
powering on a virtual machine before monitoring for heartbeats. Default:
`120` (2 minutes).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1111">property <b>haVmMonitoring</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMonitoring?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The type of virtual machine monitoring to use
when HA is enabled in the cluster. Can be one of `vmMonitoringDisabled`,
`vmMonitoringOnly`, or `vmAndAppMonitoring`. Default: `vmMonitoringDisabled`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmRestartAdditionalDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1117">property <b>haVmRestartAdditionalDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmRestartAdditionalDelay?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Additional delay in seconds
after ready condition is met. A VM is considered ready at this point.
Default: `0` (no delay). <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmRestartPriority">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1123">property <b>haVmRestartPriority</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmRestartPriority?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The default restart priority
for affected virtual machines when vSphere detects a host failure. Can be one
of `lowest`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, or `highest`. Default: `medium`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterArgs-haVmRestartTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L1130">property <b>haVmRestartTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmRestartTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum time, in seconds,
that vSphere HA will wait for virtual machines in one priority to be ready
before proceeding with the next priority. Default: `600` (10 minutes).

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum number
of failed hosts that admission control tolerates when making decisions on
whether to permit virtual machine operations. The maximum is one less than
the number of hosts in the cluster. Default: `1`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L608">property <b>haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlPerformanceTolerance?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The percentage of
resource reduction that a cluster of virtual machines can tolerate in case of
a failover. A value of 0 produces warnings only, whereas a value of 100
disables the setting. Default: `100` (disabled).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlPolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L614">property <b>haAdmissionControlPolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlPolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The type of admission control
policy to use with vSphere HA. Can be one of `resourcePercentage`,
`slotPolicy`, `failoverHosts`, or `disabled`. Default: `resourcePercentage`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L624">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageAutoCompute?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Automatically determine available resource percentages by subtracting the
average number of host resources represented by the
`haAdmissionControlHostFailureTolerance`
setting from the total amount of resources in the cluster. Disable to supply
user-defined values. Default: `true`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L630">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageCpu?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined percentage of CPU resources in the cluster to reserve for
failover. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L636">property <b>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlResourcePercentageMemory?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined percentage of memory resources in the cluster to reserve for
failover. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L641">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitCpu?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined CPU slot size, in MHz. Default: `32`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L646">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyExplicitMemory?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the
user-defined memory slot size, in MB. Default: `100`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L653">property <b>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdmissionControlSlotPolicyUseExplicitSize?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls
whether or not you wish to supply explicit values to CPU and memory slot
sizes. The default is `false`, which tells vSphere to gather a automatic
average based on all powered-on virtual machines currently in the cluster.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haAdvancedOptions">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L658">property <b>haAdvancedOptions</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haAdvancedOptions?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;}&gt;;</code></pre>

A key/value map that specifies advanced
options for vSphere HA.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L665">property <b>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdRecoveryAction?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take
on virtual machines if an APD status on an affected datastore clears in the
middle of an APD event. Can be one of `none` or `reset`. Default: `none`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L673">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected loss to all paths to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`,
`restartConservative`, or `restartAggressive`.  Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastoreApdResponseDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L680">property <b>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastoreApdResponseDelay?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the delay in minutes
to wait after an APD timeout event to execute the response action defined in
`haDatastoreApdResponse`. Default: `3`
minutes. <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haDatastorePdlResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L688">property <b>haDatastorePdlResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haDatastorePdlResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls the action to take on
virtual machines when the cluster has detected a permanent device loss to a
relevant datastore. Can be one of `disabled`, `warning`, or
`restartAggressive`. Default: `disabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haEnabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L693">property <b>haEnabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haEnabled?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable vSphere HA for this cluster. Default:
`false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHeartbeatDatastoreIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L700">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastoreIds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The list of managed object IDs for
preferred datastores to use for HA heartbeating. This setting is only useful
when `haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy` is set
to either `userSelectedDs` or `allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L707">property <b>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHeartbeatDatastorePolicy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The selection policy for HA
heartbeat datastores. Can be one of `allFeasibleDs`, `userSelectedDs`, or
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`. Default:
`allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHostIsolationResponse">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L714">property <b>haHostIsolationResponse</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHostIsolationResponse?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The action to take on virtual
machines when a host has detected that it has been isolated from the rest of
the cluster. Can be one of `none`, `powerOff`, or `shutdown`. Default:
`none`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haHostMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L720">property <b>haHostMonitoring</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haHostMonitoring?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Global setting that controls whether
vSphere HA remediates virtual machines on host failure. Can be one of `enabled`
or `disabled`. Default: `enabled`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmComponentProtection">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L727">property <b>haVmComponentProtection</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmComponentProtection?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls vSphere VM component
protection for virtual machines in this cluster. Can be one of `enabled` or
`disabled`. Default: `enabled`.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmDependencyRestartCondition">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L737">property <b>haVmDependencyRestartCondition</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmDependencyRestartCondition?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The condition used to
determine whether or not virtual machines in a certain restart priority class
are online, allowing HA to move on to restarting virtual machines on the next
priority. Can be one of `none`, `poweredOn`, `guestHbStatusGreen`, or
`appHbStatusGreen`. The default is `none`, which means that a virtual machine
is considered ready immediately after a host is found to start it on.
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmFailureInterval">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L743">property <b>haVmFailureInterval</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmFailureInterval?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If a heartbeat from a virtual machine
is not received within this configured interval, the virtual machine is
marked as failed. The value is in seconds. Default: `30`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMaximumFailureWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L752">property <b>haVmMaximumFailureWindow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMaximumFailureWindow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The length of the reset window in
which `haVmMaximumResets` can operate. When this
window expires, no more resets are attempted regardless of the setting
configured in `haVmMaximumResets`. `-1` means no window, meaning an
unlimited reset time is allotted. The value is specified in seconds. Default:
`-1` (no window).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMaximumResets">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L757">property <b>haVmMaximumResets</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMaximumResets?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum number of resets that HA will
perform to a virtual machine when responding to a failure event. Default: `3`

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMinimumUptime">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L763">property <b>haVmMinimumUptime</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMinimumUptime?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The time, in seconds, that HA waits after
powering on a virtual machine before monitoring for heartbeats. Default:
`120` (2 minutes).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmMonitoring">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L769">property <b>haVmMonitoring</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmMonitoring?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The type of virtual machine monitoring to use
when HA is enabled in the cluster. Can be one of `vmMonitoringDisabled`,
`vmMonitoringOnly`, or `vmAndAppMonitoring`. Default: `vmMonitoringDisabled`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmRestartAdditionalDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L775">property <b>haVmRestartAdditionalDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmRestartAdditionalDelay?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Additional delay in seconds
after ready condition is met. A VM is considered ready at this point.
Default: `0` (no delay). <sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmRestartPriority">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L781">property <b>haVmRestartPriority</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmRestartPriority?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The default restart priority
for affected virtual machines when vSphere detects a host failure. Can be one
of `lowest`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, or `highest`. Default: `medium`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-haVmRestartTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L788">property <b>haVmRestartTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>haVmRestartTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The maximum time, in seconds,
that vSphere HA will wait for virtual machines in one priority to be ready
before proceeding with the next priority. Default: `600` (10 minutes).
<sup>\*</sup>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-hostClusterExitTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/computeCluster.ts#L794">property <b>hostClusterExitTimeout</b></a>

The timeout for each host maintenance mode
operation when removing hosts from a cluster. The value is specified in
seconds. Default: `3600` (1 hour).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ComputeClusterState-hostSystemIds">

balance the load. Default: `5` percent.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="DatastoreClusterArgs-sdrsIoReservableIopsThreshold">

The threshold of reservable
IOPS of all virtual machines on the datastore before storage DRS makes
recommendations to move VMs off of a datastore. Note that this setting should
only be set if `sdrsIoReservablePercentThreshold` cannot make an accurate
estimate of the capacity of the datastores in your cluster, and should be set
to roughly 50-60% of the worst case peak performance of the backing LUNs.

The threshold, in
percent, of actual estimated performance of the datastore (in IOPS) that

template. These are sorted by bus and unit number so that they can be applied
to a `vsphere..VirtualMachine` resource in the order the resource expects
while cloning. This is useful for discovering certain disk settings while
performing a linked clone, as all settings that are output by this data
source must be the same on the destination virtual machine as the source.
Only the first number of controllers defined by `scsiControllerScanCount`
are scanned for disks. The sub-attributes are:

unlimited reset time is allotted. The value is specified in seconds. Default:
`-1` (no window).

simplified view of shares. Levels map to a pre-determined set of numeric

ignored.  Default: `normal`

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestIpTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1381">property <b>waitForGuestIpTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestIpTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available guest IP address on this virtual machine. This should
only be used if your version of VMware Tools does not allow the
`waitForGuestNetTimeout` waiter to be
used. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 0.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestNetRoutable">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1390">property <b>waitForGuestNetRoutable</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetRoutable?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls whether or not the guest
network waiter waits for a routable address. When `false`, the waiter does
not wait for a default gateway, nor are IP addresses checked against any
discovered default gateways as part of its success criteria. This property is
ignored if the `waitForGuestIpTimeout`
waiter is used. Default: `true`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineArgs-waitForGuestNetTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1399">property <b>waitForGuestNetTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available IP address on this virtual machine's NICs. Older
versions of VMware Tools do not populate this property. In those cases, this
waiter can be disabled and the
`waitForGuestIpTimeout` waiter can be used
instead. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 5 minutes.

this virtual machine. Can be one of `hvAuto`, `hvOn`, or `hvOff`. Default:

<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1028">property <b>waitForGuestNetRoutable</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetRoutable?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Controls whether or not the guest
network waiter waits for a routable address. When `false`, the waiter does
not wait for a default gateway, nor are IP addresses checked against any
discovered default gateways as part of its success criteria. This property is
ignored if the `waitForGuestIpTimeout`
waiter is used. Default: `true`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="VirtualMachineState-waitForGuestNetTimeout">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-vsphere/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/sdk/nodejs/virtualMachine.ts#L1037">property <b>waitForGuestNetTimeout</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForGuestNetTimeout?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount of time, in minutes, to
wait for an available IP address on this virtual machine's NICs. Older
versions of VMware Tools do not populate this property. In those cases, this
waiter can be disabled and the
`waitForGuestIpTimeout` waiter can be used
instead. A value less than 1 disables the waiter. Default: 5 minutes.
